alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 12:16PM MDT until June 01 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Curry County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Northwestern Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 1216 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.00 and 2.50 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Melrose, Grady, Broadview, Wheatland and Bellview. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 352 and 367. State Routes 209, 252, 268 and 275 may be impacted by flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
